title: Cloud Architecture Center - Delete a cloud volume
abstract:
# Cloud Architecture Center - Delete a cloud volume
Last reviewed 2023-07-05 UTC
Whether you create an NFS or SMB volume, you can delete a cloud volume that's no longer needed.
**Important:** Once you delete a cloud volume, you can't restore it; the deletion operation is irreversible.
- In the Google Cloud console, go to the **Volumes** page. [Go to the Volumes page](https://console.cloud.google.com/netapp/cloud-volumes/volumes) 
- In the **Volumes** view, select the volume that you want to delete, and then click **Delete** . 
- In the **Delete Volume** dialog, click **Confirm** to delete the volume.
